_json.gridTitle: The Most Charming Home In France
_json.description: Luce refers to his small farm, or fermette, as Sous Bois, a terroir designation for wines with an earthy nose as well as a genre of landscape painting depicting woodland scenes. "Literally, it means a shady, woodsy place," he says. His emblem for the house, added to stationery and as sculpture to the gardens he planted on the hillsides, is a snail. The world associates escargot with good eating, but for Luce snails signify the slow, deliberate pace of life the French embrace, which he discov...
